New Records: The New York Yankees clinched their 32nd consecutive winning season, matching the second-longest such period in MLB history behind a 39-season streak from 1926-64.
Key Match Events: Clarke Schmidt pitched 4 2/3 innings of four-hit ball in his first big league game since May 26, and Nestor Cortes closed it out in his first relief appearance since 2021.
Pre-Game Insights: Chicago (72-70) has lost four of five on a crucial homestand as it tries to rally in the race for the third NL wild card.
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs right-hander Javier Assad (7-5) allowed one earned run and three hits in 5 2/3 innings. New York scored its first run when Austin Wells drove in Gleyber Torres with a groundout in the first.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Wrigley Field with a crowd of 40,080 fans, and the Yankees' Anthony Rizzo heard more cheers in his second game back at Wrigley Field since being traded to New York in July 2021.
